result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (4th Offense)] and Operating w/ PAC (4th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (4th Offense)]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (4th Offense)] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (4th Offense)] was dismissed by the court.

  • Samuel M Short was found guilty of OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (4th Offense)], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Samuel M Short was found guilty of Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $1100 fine plus costs. 60 days to pay.
Consecutive to prison being served. Good time and Huber privileges granted.
Any vehicle driven by or registered to Defendant during period of IID restriction must be equipped with Ignition Interlock Device unless otherwise ordered by the Court.
Obtain AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations. Defendant is required to attend a Victim Impact Panel within 6 months of release from prison.

miscConds.notes: Pay restitution as shown on Door County Restitution Summary, plus any statutorily authorized surcharges. Pay costs of the action. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

records.addlTxt: denying Defendant's motion to withdraw no contest plea
Kettle Moraine Correctional

Defendant Samuel M Short appeared by video conference from Kettle Moraine Correctional. Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions Defendant, who wants to proceed without counsel at this time, but may request counsel if motion is granted. Court reviews motion, questions Defendant, who makes statement regarding incident and injuries received. Court makes statement, finds that Defendant has not produced any evidence that he did not enter plea voluntarily, denies motion.
from State requesting video appearance for Defendant

Kettle Moraine Correctional

Defendant Samuel M Short appeared by video conference from Kettle Moraine Correctional. Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews Defendant's Motion. State intends to file written response, to be filed by May 18. Court will allow brief arguments, intends to present oral ruling at next hearing.  Oral ruling scheduled for May 25, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on May 3, 2017 at 11:00 am.

Door County Restitution Summary

Defendant Samuel M Short in court with attorney Brett E Reetz. Defendant Samuel M Short in custody. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, receipt of PSI, recommendation contained therein. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Bond no longer in effect.

Defendant Samuel M Short in court with attorney Brett E Reetz. Defendant Samuel M Short in custody. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest pleas to Counts 1, 2. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds pleas made freely and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds Defendant guilty of Counts 1, 2. Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Counts 3 and 4 are dismissed but read in for sentencing and/or restitution. Parties request PSI. Court orders PSI. Bond continues as is.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
adding Count 4
Defense waives reading of Information, enters not guilty pleas. Plea hearing set for April 23, 2105 at 9:30.
by State

Defendant Samuel M Short in court with attorney Brett E Reetz. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that Defendant will waive prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds Defendant over for trial.
Application, Affidavit, Return of Officer, Acknowledgment of Return of Officer

Defendant Samuel M Short in court with attorney Brett E Reetz. Defendant Samuel M Short in custody. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Complaint given to Defense last week. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim. Defense advises that Defendant will waive time limits for prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver.  Waiver of Prelim scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.

Defendant Samuel M Short appeared by video conference. Attorney Gregory A. Gerbers appeared in Court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return 3/30/15, 10:00.
